javadoc: The interface that all exporters must implement.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: name
params.comment: the display name of this exporter

params.name: extension
params.comment: the default extension for this exporter

params.name: help
params.comment: the help location for this exporter

methods.javadoc:
Returns the display name of this exporter.
@return the display name of this exporter
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Returns the display name of this exporter.

return.comment: the display name of this exporter

methods.name: getDefaultFileExtension
methods.comment:
Returns the default extension for this exporter.
 For example, .html for .xml.

return.comment: the default extension for this exporter

methods.name: getHelpLocation
methods.comment:
Returns the help location for this exporter.
 It should return null only if no help documentation exists.

return.comment: the help location for this exporter

methods.name: getMessageLog
methods.comment:
Returns the message log the may have been created during an export.
 The message log is used to log warnings and other non-critical messages.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the exporter service provider.
@param provider the exporter service provider
methods.name: setExporterServiceProvider
canExportDomainObject
methods.comment:
Returns true if this exporter knows how to export the given domain object.  For example,
 some exporters know how to export programs, other exporters can export project data type
 archives.

return.comment: true if this exporter knows how to export the given domain object.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this exporter can export less than the entire domain file.
@return true if this exporter can export less than the entire domain file.
methods.name: supportsPartialExport
methods.comment: Returns true if this exporter can export less than the entire domain file.

return.comment: true if this exporter can export less than the entire domain file.

methods.name: getOptions
methods.comment:
Returns the available options for this exporter.
 The program is needed because some exporters
 may have options that vary depending on the specific
 program being exported.

params.name: domainObjectService
params.comment: a service for retrieving the applicable domainObject.

return.comment: the available options for this exporter

methods.name: setOptions
methods.comment:
Sets the options. This method is not for defining the options, but
 rather it is for setting the values of options. If invalid options
 are passed in, then OptionException should be thrown.

params.name: options
params.comment: the option values for this exporter

throws.comment: if invalid options are passed in

methods.name: export
methods.comment: Actually does the work of exporting the program.

params.name: file
params.comment: the output file to write the exported info

params.name: addrSet
params.comment: the address set if only a portion of the program should be exported

return.comment:
true if the program was successfully exported; otherwise, false.  If the program
   was not successfully exported, the message log should be checked to find the source of
   the error.

name: Exporter
comment: The interface that all exporters must implement.
